text: HackerRank | Prepare Certify Compete Apply Search   1  All Contests SRBD Code Contest - 2023 (Round 1) Village Hidden in The Leaf  Village Hidden in The Leaf locked Problem Submissions Time Limit ++ Memory Limit Little Labib lives in a village that is hidden in the leaf. There are houses in the village located in a line and represented by an array where denotes the holding number of the ( ) house. If Labib wants to move from house he can move to his adjacent houses ( or ), where house holding number can't be a prime number. Keep in mind that he can't go outside of the village. Now you will be given queries of types. - How many houses can Labib can go to from the house with mentioned condition. - Replace the holding number of the house with . Input Format Input start with an integer denoting the number of test cases. Then testcases follow. For each test case, input starts with two integers and denoting number of houses and number of queries to be performed. Next line contains an array of integers denoting house holding numbers. Each of the next lines contains a query as described above. Constraints It is guaranteed that both the sum of and the sum of over all test cases do not exceed . Output Format For each query of type , print the expected result in a separate line. You may see the sample I/O for better explanation. Sample Input 0 1 5 5 2 1 4 3 6 1 1 1 2 1 4 2 3 5 1 4 Sample Output 0  Interview Prep | Blog | Scoring | Environment | FAQ | About Us | Support | Careers | Terms Of Service | Privacy Policy | 2 1 3 1 Explanation 0 First query: he can go house and from house . Second query: he can go only house from house . Third query: he can go house , and from house . Fourth query: he relplaced the house with new holding number , now array looks like [ , , , , ]. Fifth query: he can go only house from house .
